intro: Philgamia, commonly known as the desert star, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant has thick, fleshy leaves and stems adapted to store water, allowing it to thrive in harsh, dry environments.
